channel.title: CNET News.com
channel.description: Tech news and business reports by CNET News. Focused oninformation technology, core topics include computers, hardware, software,networking, and Internet media..
channel.copyright: 2009 CBS Interactive Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: CES: Clarity phones for seniors get customer service redo
item.description: ClarityLogic gives customer service reps full access to Clarity phones, helping seniors and hearing-impaired diagnose and fix any phone issues faster.

item.title: CES: Grab a robotic massage from the WheeMe
item.description: The tiny WheeMe robot from DreamBots can provide a full back massage when your favorite human masseuse isn't available.

item.title: CES: Mini generator powers bike lights, speakers
item.description: Jooyn Power Shenzen introduces a rear-wheel mini generator, bike lights, and a sound system with multiple speakers, all with a controller that mounts to handlebars.

item.title: CES: Flix on Stix moves movies from kiosk to USB
item.description: Launching a series of kiosks throughout the United States, Flix on Stix plans to enable people to download movies onto a USB stick, and watch them on their home computer.

item.title: CES: Conquer China (and get some cheap speakers)
item.description: Perhaps the greatest company name so far at CES is Conquer (China). It says it can make beautiful speakers compatible with your iPod or iPad. And they're cheap.

item.title: CES: Sony's tablet not aiming to be an iPad killer
item.description: Sony officially says that it's working on a tablet, but it's not ready yet. Still, the company has big plans to play catch up to the iPad sometime next year.

item.title: CES: Citi swiping Dynamics' 'smart' credit cards
item.description: Company behind innovative smart credit cards gets a big banking customer. Citigroup's trial cards let users pay with either their regular credit account or reward points.

item.title: GM and LG Chem pen new agreement with Argonne for next-gen battery technology
item.description: General Motors has licensed the use of patented material for next-generation battery packs developed by the Department of Energy's Argonne National Laboratory.

item.title: NASA working on waking Mars Spirit rover
item.description: Spirit has been out of commission for months. But NASA's Mars rover project manager says the organization is attempting to wake it up and put it back to work.

item.title: CES: Vader invades Vegas to pump Blu-ray set
item.description: Amazon.com starts discounted $89.99 preorders for the nine-disc "Star Wars" Blu-ray set, as Darth Vader does Vegas (with the help of executives from Amazon and Fox).

item.title: CES: Withings rethinks blood pressure monitor
item.description: French start-up Withings unveils a sleek and lightweight blood pressure monitor, which goes on sale this month for $129 and works with an iPhone, iPad, or iPod Touch.

item.title: CES: Skystream turbine makes most of air stream
item.description: Southwest Windpower unveils small wind turbine with claim of 7,400 kilowatt-hours of electricity per year under 12 mph average conditions.

item.title: CES: World's smallest waterproof MP3 player gets bigger
item.description: The UWaterG2, a waterproof MP3 player whose built-in lithium ion rechargeable battery lasts six to eight hours, is about to bump up to 4GB and 8GB.

item.title: GE's connected, energy-savvy home (photos)
item.description: General Electric is showing off its digital energy offering at CES, including a home energy manager, wind turbine, and electric-vehicle charger.

item.title: Apple denies it's searching for new CFO
item.description: The company is denying a Bloomberg report that it approached Blackstone's chief financial officer, Laurence Tosi, to take over the role at Apple.

item.title: CES: GE readies energy display for 'home of the future'
item.description: General Electric's digital energy display shows off a multi-product system for managing home energy, generate electricity at home, and manage electric-vehicle charging.

item.title: CES: Verizon unveils bevy of 4G devices (live blog)
item.description: At press conference, Verizon unveils a table full of new devices--10 in total--expected to make it to store shelves by the middle of this year. Among them is LG Revolution and HTC Thunderbolt.

item.title: CES: Dell targets Gen Y with Streak 7 tablet, speedy gaming
item.description: Dell news from CES: Streak 7 tablet, Venue smartphone, and the new Alienware M17x 3D, the "most powerful product to be introduced in the universe."

item.title: Microsoft to fix Windows holes, but not ones in IE
item.description: Patch Tuesday will have fixes for three Windows holes but IE vulnerabilities reportedly being exploited in attacks will not be among them.

item.title: With solar power, it's Green vs. Green
item.description: The push to create an alternative to carbon-based fuel with massive solar plants has hit an unlikely snag: environmentalists.
